data.title: Pink Floyd-Oldest and the best band in the world

data.text:

Gilmour and Equal Mason went on to record with Wright at Pink Floyds. In 1987 came the next album by Pink Floyd, which proved that the band was on the other side of the Water. Pink Floyd's new album Waterss The first Pink Floyd album reached number one in the UK and the United States, and its 1988-89 tour was the biggest in the band's history at $ 135 million. Pink Floyd is one of Britain's best-known and most successful rock bands of all time, and just being called by their name is enough to silence fans. The group, formed in 1965, underwent several name changes before compiling the first name for blues artists from Carolina, Pink Anderson, and Floyd Council. The Pink Floyd band was formed by four students in London: Syd Barrett, Roger Waters, Nick Mason, and Richard Wright, who joined David Gilmour as the fifth member in 1967.

British rock band Pink Floyd expanded the concept album with a large rock audience in the 1970s. As one of Britain’s first psychedelic groups, Pink Floyd found the foundation of early fans and was distinguished by their extensive construction, sonic experiments, philosophical texts, and extensive live shows.

Syd Barrett was the band's first genius, who sang, played guitar, and wrote many songs on the debut album The Piper at Gates of Dawn since 1967. Roger Waters wrote the names of all five Pink Floyd albums that preceded his death - from Dark Side of the Moon in 1973 to The Final Cut in 1983. Dark Side Of The Moon is the only album that sets Pink Floyd apart from all other bands in the world because of its market success.

In fact, the 11th album The Wall was the last album re-released by band members Roger Waters, David Gilmour, Nick Mason, and Richard Wright. Roger Waters' song "Set to Control the Heart of the Sun" for the band's second album, A Saucerful of Secrets, released on June 29, 1968, is perhaps the most significant.
